conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volumes, and an elevated angled view with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor limitations: viewpoint is only mildly angled (close to top-down) and some edges/openings look simplified.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen core, left-side service/office zone). However, outdoor spaces (deck and balconies) appear missing or significantly simplified, and bathroom/utility partitioning does not fully match the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa set, dining table) and kitchen cabinetry/appliances are indicated; bathrooms have basic fixtures. Some elements are simplified and a few room-specific items (e.g., office details) are minimal.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with distinct walls/floors and adequate lighting. Windows/doors are not always clearly distinguishable, and some openings read as generic gaps rather than faithful door/window geometry.

detected_errors.description: Deck and balcony geometry from the 2D plan is missing or heavily reduced in the 3D model, impacting overall footprint fidelity.
Toilet/utility partition layout appears altered (count/placement not fully consistent with the 2D plan’s multiple toilets and utility zone).
Door/window placements and sizing are simplified and not clearly aligned to all corresponding 2D openings.

summary: A valid, clean 3D cutaway with strong overall layout match, but with notable fidelity loss in balconies/deck and some service/bathroom partition details.
